newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico same-day peso closes weaker on lower rates.
newsitem.headline: Mexico same-day peso closes weaker on lower rates.

text.p: Mexico's same-day peso closed slightly weaker against the dollar on Wednesday in reaction to the sharp drop in interest rates from Tuesday's primary Cetes auction.
The same-day peso lost 0.15 of a centavo to 7.4740/7.4790.
Meanwhile, the benchmark 48-hour or spot peso fell 1.6 centavos at mid-day to 7.4830/7.4880 and the 24-hour peso lost 1.8 centavos to 7.4790/7.4840.
"The drop in interest rates was about what was expected, but in the end it was enough to affect the peso," one trader said.

Traders said the same-day peso could have lost more ground, but trading volume was light because of the street demonstration that forced the suspension of floor trading on the stock exchange all morning.
